sentence: > From censure to out-and-out political targeting, progressives want to challenge fellow Democrats they believe stand in the way of their agenda in Congress, reports The Hill’s Hanna Trudo, who offers five 2022 examples: Jessica Cisneros is challenging Rep. Henry Cuellar (Texas); Rana Abdelhamid wants to defeat Rep. Carolyn Maloney (New York); Kina Collins is targeting Rep. Danny K. Davis (Illinois); Odessa Kelly is taking aim at Rep. Jim Cooper (Tennessee); and Ohio underdog Morgan Harper would like to best Rep. Tim Ryan for contention in the state’s Senate primary in May (she will face off during a debate on Thursday against Republican Senate candidate Josh Mandel in Columbus) (Cleveland.com).
title: The Hill’s Morning Report – Biden, NATO eye ‘all scenarios’ with Russia

sentence: The winner of the Republican primary will face the winner of a Democrat primary that includes 10-term U.S. Rep. Tim Ryan and progressive Morgan Harper, a former consumer protection attorney.

sentence: The Buckeye State has swerved pretty hard to the red side in recent years, but the Democrats have a very credible likely candidate in Congressman Tim Ryan (he has a primary against left-leaning Morgan Harper on May 3, and while I’m not seeing much polling, people I know in the state expect Ryan to win—he certainly has a ton more money).
author: Michael Tomasky
title: The Not-Too Early Guide to the Upcoming Senate Primaries
